name: Inside No. 9 (Series 2)
summary: Pemberton and Shearsmith confirmed on 29 January 2014 that the show would be returning for a second series and that it would enter production in the autumn of this year.

eps.name: The 12 Days of Christine
eps.desc: Christine (Sheridan Smith) meets Adam (Tom Riley) at a New Year party. Her life begins to unravel around her as events seem to take place out of sequence and she is haunted by visions of an unknown man. The episode takes place over twelve holidays or important occasions in Christine's lifetime.

eps.name: The Trial of Elizabeth Gadge
eps.desc: In the 17th century, Elizabeth Gadge (Ruth Sheen) stands accused of witchcraft; she will be burnt at the stake if found guilty. Village magistrate Justice Pike (David Warner) summons feared witch-finders Mr Warren (Shearsmith) and Mr Clarke (Pemberton) to investigate, while planning to use the trial to increase outside interest in the village.

eps.name: Cold Comfort
eps.desc: Andy (Pemberton) starts work at the Comfort Support Line, a helpline for distressed people to talk about their problems. His colleagues George (Shearsmith), Liz (Jane Horrocks) and Joanne (Nikki Amuka-Bird) are only too happy to help, but one caller isn't what they seem. The episode is filmed on four fixed CCTV cameras.

eps.name: Nana's Party
eps.desc: Much-loved grandmother Maggie (Elsie Kelly) is celebrating her 79th birthday, and her family plans a party for her, complete with a huge cake. However, Jim (Pemberton) is angry at a practical joke from his brother-in-law Pat (Shearsmith), and intends to get back at him during the party. The "jokes" escalate with devastating consequences.

eps.name: Seance Time
eps.desc: Having never consulted the spirit world before, Tina (Sophie McShera) isn't quite sure what to expect. Her visit to the spiritualist medium Madam Talbot (Alison Steadman) has been arranged by her sister. Hives (Shearsmith), Talbot's assistant in the mundane world, seems quite helpful, but there's something already waiting for Tina on the Other Side, and Hives knows all about it.
